definition:
Let $A$, $B$, and $C$ be abelian groups. A bilinear form

$$\varphi: A\times B \rightarrow C$$ is said to be ** if the associated
group homomorphisms

$$\begin{aligned}
A &\rightarrow \operatorname{Hom}(B,C)\\
a &\mapsto \varphi(a,\cdot)\end{aligned}$$

and $$\begin{aligned}
B &\rightarrow \operatorname{Hom}(A,C)\\
b &\mapsto \varphi(\cdot,b)\end{aligned}$$ are injective.

In particular, if $C$ is finite then the finiteness of either $A$ or $B$
implies the finiteness of the other.
